sec_ollama_sub: Prefer local processing? Connect OCRBook to your own Ollama server.
ollama_body: Use Ollama to summarize, translate, or ask questions â€” while keeping content on your own machine. If you connect over plain HTTP, traffic may not be encrypted. Use a trusted network or HTTPS where possible.
faq1_q: Does OCRBook modify my original PDF?
faq1_a: No. Your original file stays untouched. OCR text is stored separately and you can switch between views anytime.
faq2_a: Yes. OCR and reading work offline. Optional integrations may require a network connection if you enable them.
faq3_q: Can I export the OCR text?
faq3_a: Yes. Copy passages, share selected text, or export the full OCR result as a plain text file.
policy_meta_desc: Privacy Policy for OCRBook app. Learn how we handle your data.
policy_intro: This Privacy Policy describes how the app OCRBook ("the App") handles user data.
policy_collection_body: The App does not collect, store, or transmit any personal information. All images, templates, and generated content remain on the user's device.
policy_files_body: The App may request access to your photo library or Files app solely for the purpose of importing images and documents selected by the user. No data is uploaded to external servers without user consent.
policy_ai_body: When using the AI-powered text generation or translation feature, the App communicates with a user-configured Ollama instance. The App does not log or store the content processed by AI.
policy_thirdparty_body: The App does not use third-party analytics, advertising SDKs, or tracking technologies.
policy_changes_body: This Privacy Policy may be updated from time to time. Any changes will be reflected on this page.
policy_contact_body: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact the developer via the App Store support page.
ollama_tut_meta_desc: Learn how to set up Ollama for local AI features in OCRBook. Step-by-step guide for macOS, Windows, and Linux.
ollama_tut_intro: Connect OCRBook to your local Ollama server for AI-powered summarization, translation, and Q&A â€” all without sending data to the cloud.
ollama_tut_what_body: Ollama is a free, open-source tool that lets you run large language models (LLMs) locally on your Mac, Windows, or Linux computer. It provides a simple API that apps like OCRBook can use to access AI features without cloud services.
ollama_tut_install_body: Download and install Ollama from the official website:
ollama_tut_install_mac: macOS: Download the .dmg file and drag Ollama to Applications.
ollama_tut_install_win: Windows: Download the installer and follow the setup wizard.
ollama_tut_install_linux: Linux: Run curl -fsSL https://ollama.com/install.sh | sh in your terminal.
ollama_tut_model_body: After installing, open your terminal and pull a model. Here are some recommended options:
ollama_tut_tip_body: Start with gemma3:4b or llama3.2:3b if your Mac has 8 GB RAM. For 16 GB+ RAM, try gemma3:12b for better results.
ollama_tut_start_body: On macOS, Ollama starts automatically when you open the app. You can verify it's running by visiting:
ollama_tut_start_check: If you see "Ollama is running", you're good to go!
ollama_tut_network_body: By default, Ollama only listens on localhost. To connect from OCRBook on your iPhone or iPad, you need to expose it to your local network.
ollama_tut_network_mac: On macOS: Set the environment variable before starting Ollama:
ollama_tut_warning_body: Only enable network access on trusted networks (like your home Wi-Fi). Traffic over plain HTTP is not encrypted. Avoid using public networks.
ollama_tut_config_body: In OCRBook, go to Settings â†’ AI Server and enter your Ollama server URL:
ollama_tut_config_ip: Find your computer's IP address in System Settings â†’ Network (on Mac) or ipconfig (on Windows).
ollama_tut_config_model: Then select your downloaded model from the model list in OCRBook.
ollama_tut_trouble_1: Can't connect: Check that Ollama is running and your firewall allows port 11434.
ollama_tut_trouble_2: Slow responses: Try a smaller model or close other apps to free up RAM.
ollama_tut_trouble_3: Model not listed: Make sure you've pulled the model with ollama pull [model].
ollama_tut_trouble_4: iOS can't connect: Ensure both devices are on the same Wi-Fi and OLLAMA_HOST is set to 0.0.0.0.
